intro: Pilosella procerigena, commonly known as the slender hairy cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Pilosella procerigena is often found in regions with temperate climates and well-drained soils.
